title: The plan to create a smokefree generation in England
description: Everyone knows smoking is bad for you, but if you’ve ever craved that first cigarette of the day, you’ll know it’s not just a habit that’s hard to kick, but an addiction.

title: Sunak Faces Electoral Tests That Risk Encouraging Tory Plotters
description: (Bloomberg) -- Rishi Sunak faces a double electoral test on Thursday that could trigger further division in his Conservative Party and undermine his bid to stop the Labour Party from taking power in a UK-wide vote expected in the fall. Most Read from ...

title: Putin says he wants Biden to win US election
description: Russian leader dismissed concerns about Mr Biden's age and mental acuity, saying he saw 'nothing of the sort' when they met three years ago

title: Government to fund more police patrols in anti-social behaviour hotspots
description: Every force will receive at least £1 million, with the Metropolitan Police being given more than £8 million, West Midlands receiving at least £3 million while Greater Manchester Police, Merseyside and West Yorkshire will all get more than £2 million each, the Home Office said.

title: UK records worst year for antisemitism after outbreak of Israel-Hamas war
description: Britain recorded thousands of antisemitic incidents after the outbreak of war between Israel and Hamas in October, making 2023 the worst year for UK antisemitism since 1984, when Jewish advisory body CST began recording such data,

title: Shameful shambles over mega-nukes
description: You can think of better ways to describe the financially radioactive shambles, complete with Rishi Sunak’s fantasy “road map”. He’s glibly promising 24 gigawatts of capacity by 2050 — either another seven Hinkley Point Cs or a mix of them and SMRs.

title: Sunak braced for double by-election test in Wellingborough and Kingswood
description: Rishi Sunak is braced for tests in Wellingborough and Kingswood, where Labour hopes to flip Tory majorities in the tens of thousands.

title: Rishi Sunak's GB News appearance sparks Ofcom complaints
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak 's appearance on GB News People's Forum on Monday, February 12 generated 122 complaints to TV Watchdog Ofcom. The complaints related to the format of the programme, which was presented in a question-and-answer style.

title: From inflation to growth, how is Rishi Sunak doing on his five pledges
description: Rishi Sunak is this week facing a crucial test of some of economic promises he made as part of his five key priorities.

title: Sunak criticises ‘mobs targeting MPs’ after protest outside Ellwood’s home
description: Rishi Sunak has appeared to criticise a pro-Palestinian protest outside Conservative MP Tobias Ellwood’s home, saying democracy should be protected from “aggressive mobs”. The Prime Minister said “we will never let those who intimidate prevail ...

title: Rishi Sunak launches crackdown on anti-social behaviour with police to get £66 million to carry out 900,000 hours of patrols in hotspots
description: Rishi Sunak launches a major new crackdown on yobs today, handing police tens of millions of pounds to patrol anti-social behaviour blackspots.

title: Sunak braced for double by-election test in Wellingborough and Kingswood
description: Rishi Sunak is braced for tests in Wellingborough and Kingswood, where Labour hopes to flip Tory majorities in the tens of thousands.

title: Government to fund more police patrols in anti-social behaviour hotspots
description: Every force will receive at least £1 million, with the Metropolitan Police being given more than £8 million, West Midlands receiving at least £3 million while Greater Manchester Police, Merseyside and West Yorkshire will all get more than £2 million each, the Home Office said.

title: Sunak digs in for new Blackstone HQ
description: Prime minister hails decision to build European headquarters in Berkeley Square as “vote of confidence in the British economy”

title: NHS nursing recruitment crisis 'could push health service to complete collapse'
description: A crisis in nursing recruitment could push the NHS to collapse, a union boss has warned, as new UCAS figures showed another sharp decrease in people applying for degree courses

title: Brendan Clarke-Smith column: If we stick to the plan we can keep on growing our economy
description: I watched Rishi Sunak answer questions from the public on GB News’s People’s Forum and his answers on this subject really struck a chord with me. Parents want the best for their children and we should understand that every child has different needs and ...

title: Economy has turned corner, Sunak tells first meeting of 2024 Business Council
description: Rishi Sunak labelled himself ‘unashamedly pro-business’ as he delivered some short opening remarks to chief executives in Downing Street.
